thread.title_full: Long Beach State Women's Volleyball Welcomes Naseri Tumanuvao

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Long Beach State Women's Volleyball Welcomes Naseri Tumanuvao
text:
Long Beach State Women’s Volleyball Welcomes Naseri Tumanuvao
Long Beach State Women's Volleyball has appointed Naseri Tumanuvao as the new Associate Head Coach. Tumanuvao, a seasoned collegiate coach with a decade of experience in the Big West, previously served at UC Irvine, where he significantly improved the team's performance. Head Coach Natalie Reagan praised Tumanuvao's experience and recruitment abilities, emphasizing his commitment to developing student-athletes both on and off the court. His local ties and involvement in the volleyball community position him well to strengthen the program.
By the Numbers- Tumanuvao helped UC Irvine improve from last in 2019 to four consecutive seasons of .500 or better in Big West play.
- As a player, Tumanuvao graduated with 636 career kills and was named NAIA Player of the Year.
- Tumanuvao joins a Long Beach State program looking to enhance its competitiveness in the Big West.
- The coaching staff aims to leverage Tumanuvao’s local connections and recruitment skills to attract talent.
With Tumanuvao on board, the focus will shift to solidifying team culture and strategizing recruitment plans ahead of the upcoming season. His integration into the program will likely look to strengthen Long Beach’s performance in future competitions.
Bottom LineNaseri Tumanuvao's hiring marks a crucial step for Long Beach State Women's Volleyball, bringing experienced leadership and community ties that are expected to promote player development and enhance the program's reputation in collegiate volleyball.
Read more at Long Beach State University Athletics
